question:
With respect to the temperature variation on earth, consider the following statements:
  1. Highest Temperature of ocean surface has been recorded on Equator
  2. Average annual temperatures for the northern hemisphere is more than that of southern hemisphere
Which among the above statements is / are correct?
explanation: Highest temperature is not recorded at the equator rather it is a bit north of it. Also we should note that the average annual temperature of all the oceans is 17.2°C. The average annual temperatures for the northern and southern hemispheres are 19.4°C and 16.1°C respectively.
